org.jpws.pwslib.data
Class PwsFileOutputSocket

java.lang.Object
  org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFileOutputSocket

public class PwsFileOutputSocket
extends java.lang.Object

PwsFileOutputSocket organises data output to a simple underlying data stream for the purposes of creating a persistent state of a PWS file. This includes realization of different file format versions and makes these differences opaque to the user. It also fully organizes creation of an encryption cipher and its application to a block-segmented data stream.

Since:
2-0-0
See Also:
PwsBlockOutputStream, PwsFileOutputSocket.RawFieldWriter

Constructor Detail

PwsFileOutputSocket

public PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output,
                           PwsPassphrase key,
                           int fileVersion)
Creates an output socket with an empty header field list. (Essential header fields will be created with default values where necessary.)

Parameters:
output - the target output stream
key - PwsPassphrase secret key for the encryption cipher
fileVersion - file format version to be created (values of class Global)

PwsFileOutputSocket

public PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output,
                           PwsPassphrase key,
                           HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                           int fileVersion)
Creates an output socket with full settings, including optional file generic header data.

Parameters:
output - the target output stream
key - PwsPassphrase secret key for the encryption cipher (file access key)
fileVersion - file format version to be created (values of class Global)
headerFields - file generic header data in a HeaderFieldList (e.g. contains user options, file-UUID, etc.); may be null

PwsFileOutputSocket

public PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output,
                           PwsPassphrase key,
                           HeaderFieldList headerFields)
Creates an output socket for the latest file format version (V3) and optional file generic header data.

Parameters:
output - the target output stream
key - PwsPassphrase secret key for the encryption cipher (file access key)
headerFields - file generic header data in a HeaderFieldList (e.g. contains user options, file-UUID, etc.); may be null
Method Detail

destroy

public void destroy()
Destroys any sensible data in this object and renders it unusable. (This can be called without prior call to close().)

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes this socket but not the underlying output stream. (Includes a call to destroy().)

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getFileID

public UUID getFileID()
Returns the file identifier UUID or null if it is not available. (Available only for V3 files)

Returns:
UUID file identifier value

getIterations

public int getIterations()
The number of security iterations of key calculation during file authentication or file-save.

Returns:
number of calculation iterations
Since:
2-1-0

setIterations

public void setIterations(int iterations)
Sets the number of security iterations of key calculation occuring during file authentication or file-save. The parameter value is corrected to comply with a minimum of 2048.

Parameters:
iterations - number of calculation iterations
Since:
2-1-0

getRawFieldWriter

public PwsFileOutputSocket.RawFieldWriter getRawFieldWriter()
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
Returns an object specialised to write PWS raw fields to the underlying data stream. Calling this will initially create the header of the new PWS file in the output stream.

Returns:
RawFieldWriter
Throws:
java.io.IOException

getBlockOutputStream

public PwsBlockOutputStream getBlockOutputStream()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Returns a data-block oriented output stream designed to realize the contents of a PWS datafile to the underlying output stream. Calling this will initially create the header of the new PWS file in the output stream.

Returns:
PwsBlockOutputStream
Throws:
java.io.IOException
